articles.title: In a win for Trump, US House passes three landmark cryptocurrency bills
articles.summary: The US House of Representatives on Thursday passed three landmark cryptocurrency bills. The CLARITY Act aims to establish a clearer regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies and other digital assets. The GENIUS Act codifies the use of stablecoins – cryptocurrencies pegged to stable assets like the US dollar or US bonds. The House also passed the Anti-CBDC Surveillance State Act, which blocks the issuance of a central bank digital currency.

articles.title: House passes three crypto bills with varying Democratic support
articles.author: Mark Schoeff Jr.
articles.summary: The House passed three bills on Thursday that would shape how digital assets operate and are overseen. One of the bills would establish regulations for stablecoins, a crypto token that is tied to a reserve currency. Another bill would set rules for the offering, sale and regulation of digital assets generally. The third bill would prevent the Federal Reserve from issuing a central bank digital currency. Democrats opposed the bills, asserting they contain weak safeguards for consumers and financial stability and to prevent money-laundering and other malfeasance.
